Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of children using a mobile phone in causing the gas station explosion.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the explosion was actually caused by a build-up of pressure inside the natural gas cylinder, not mobile phone use.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as no news reports examined asserted that mobile phone use was the cause of the explosion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that mobile phone use by children in the backseat caused the explosion, without sufficient evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that the explosion was caused by a build-up of pressure inside the natural gas cylinder.
